alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 9:36PM CDT until June 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 PM CDT, radar indicated a band of thunderstorms with very heavy rain repeatedly tracking east across Brown County, from Bangs to Brownwood to just south of Blanket. Rainfall of one half to one inch has already occurred, and an additional half to one inch is expected through 1045 PM. Street flooding is expected in Brownwood. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Early, Bangs, Blanket and Camp Bowie. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Gifford at Beaver, Austin Street at Avenue G, Cordell at Anderson, Good Shephard at 11th, Indian Creek at 9th, Belle Plain at Romines, 4th Street at Wood, Willis at Belmeade, Magnolia at Belmeade and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
